DOC.brief_summary: For majority patient , management HIV-1 infection involve effective well tolerated antiretroviral therapy simplify pill load dosing , exemplified availability single tablet regimen ( STRs ) single tablet daily dosing . STR therapy show improve adherence reduce hospitalisation ( Cohen et al. , 2013 ; Sax et al. , 2012 ) . However , age HIV cohort Australia globally raise issue increase co-morbidities consequent polypharmacy manage ( Jansson & Wilson , 2012 ; Edelman et al. , 2013 ) . Polypharmacy may impact adherence , also increase potential drug-drug interaction ( Holtzman et al. , 2013 ) . Stribild , highly effective STR , contain cobicistat boost level component integrase inhibitor , elvitegravir . Cobicistat antiretroviral activity , act inhibit Cyp3A4 cytochrome p450 metabolic pathway . Other drug metabolize via pathway may affect drug-drug interaction ( Rogatto et al. , 2014 ) . Additionally evidence increase risk nephrotoxicity co-administration tenofovir non-steroidal anti-inflammatory medication ( NSAIDS ) ( Marcotte et al. , 2008 ) . Data use concomitant medication Australian patient HIV sparse . This study aim determine , large caseload community HIV practice , use concomitant medication HIV , patient pill load dose frequency , potential drug-drug interaction stribild .
DOC.brief_title: Use Concomitant Medications HIV-1 Infected Patients Large Community Practice Sydney , Australia
